intro: Lepidium prostratum, commonly known as匍匐芥菜, is a low-growing annual herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features small, green, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense racemes. The plant produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in wet meadows. Lepidium prostratum is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants.
